I‚Äôm not sure if it passed actually but Ford spoke about it recently and said something along those lines. 

I definitely don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs cancelling rent or encouraging people not to pay rent.. but maybe just to take a little pressure off. 

I think during these times landlord and tenant should be willing to work together. There are people who will genuinely maybe need a bit of extra time, and people who will try to take advantage and use it as an excuse. 

But especially for small landlords, it‚Äôs not fair for tenants to think that they are excused from paying at all, even if they may be struggling financially right now.
Legislation passed to block landlords from evicting tenants during this time. Landlords are people who are worrying about their bills, just as renters are. We‚Äôre all in this together.

She formed an opinion on one of my romantic relationships and accused me of having ill intentions (within that relationship) that I didn‚Äôt have and wouldn‚Äôt listen to me when I told her otherwise. She brought up things I told her about arguments with previous partners of mine and used them against me. She berated my other friendships and said she was my only real friend and that all of the others are fake because they don‚Äôt tell me the things she tells me about myself. She accused me of wanting ‚Äúyes friends‚Äù because I refused to engage in a back and forth text war (that I realized only made things worse, which is why I stopped participating in it) with her when she came at me with walls of text telling me how shitty I am. She accused me of having a bunch of crap qualities overall. She was my closest and longest friendship. The cards are on the table to rekindle the friendship but at this point I‚Äôm thinking the both of us might be better off staying separate. Part of me wonders if she‚Äôs right and if I‚Äôll ever meet women who really love me. I think she must be the only one who really cared and loved me because she put up with my crap qualities. But I know that‚Äôs my toxic brain wiring. But a small part of me fears that it‚Äôs not.

I wouldn‚Äôt even slap it into the jaywalking category. It‚Äôs a different story if you bought the car from a dealer or someone on kijiji. If your dad agrees it was a gift from him to you, get the papers notarized, go to service Ontario and be on your way. The notary seal is your ticket. It won‚Äôt come back to haunt you down the line. It‚Äôs all legal.
Cheat? It‚Äôs a legitimate route. It‚Äôs a transfer from one family member to another family member. Why would he pay PST if he doesn‚Äôt have to?

There is a form that you can fill out to say that the car was a gift from your father to you that will prevent you from having to pay PST . If nothing has changed when I did it 6 yeas ago, then you‚Äôll need to go with your father to have it notarized from a notary (cost me $50). Take it to Service ON, get the ownership in your name, call up your insurance company and you‚Äôre golden.
